amendment.description: To expand the definition of armor piercing ammunition and to require the Attorney General to promulgate standards for the uniform testing of projectiles against body armor.

vote.text: Amendment SA 2619 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 34 - 63. Record Vote Number: 28.

action.text: Amendment SA 2619 proposed by Senator Kennedy. (consideration: CR S1634-1639; text: CR S1634) To expand the definition of armor piercing ammunition and to require the Attorney General to promulgate standards for the uniform testing of projectiles against body armor.
Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 2619 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 34 - 63. Record Vote Number: 28.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 2619 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 34 - 63. Record Vote Number: 28.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 2619 proposed by Senator Kennedy.
